reviewTitle: Impressive piece of tech with almost zero real world purpose for the average person
reviewDescription: I'm an Apple guy. I got this watch on a whim because it was on sale and I thought it'd be a nice companion to my new iPhone and Mac Studio. I waited a few weeks before writing a review because I felt like I might've just been "missing something" but I think I can now admit that this tech is just aggressively not for me and I'd bet it's not for the average person either.The first thing that really shocked me was that it doesn't feature that classic Apple "it just works" kind of software design literally at all. I'm sure it's obviously extremely challenging to pare down all of the "features" to the size of a watch face, and maybe the Apple Watch is the smart watch to do it the best so far, but even if that's true, that doesn't mean it's actually good. I felt like it wasn't remotely intuitive.Once I got my head wrapped around it though, it disappointed me with the lack of exciting apps available for the device. Sure, you can get text messages and download podcasts to it, but unless you're an avid runner who somehow doesn't already have a solution to this issue, in what real-world scenario are you not going to have your phone on you at literally all times? I supposed the fitness tracking stuff is interesting as well, but to get the most out of it you pretty much have to be wearing your watch for 24 hours a day. You could take it off overnight, but then you miss out on the sleep tracking. I get you have to charge it at some point, but I bring this up to say that some of the most-hyped features of the phone, by default, aren't as helpful as they could be because of this admittedly unsolvable technical limitation.This brings me to my most damning criticism, it's just plain not comfortable. I hate wearing it. Sure, it looks cool as a fashion statement, but out of the (admittedly, very few) watches I've worn in my life, this is the least comfortable by far.Unless you already have a VERY specific use-case for one of these and you know ahead of time exactly what you need it for, strongly consider saving your money. You won't be surprised by some magical super-cool applefied use-case like I was hoping to be. It sure looks cool as an accessory to your fits, but that's about it.

By the way the term “complications” threw me off at first because it simply refers to the options you’d like displayed on your watch face such as temperature, heart rate, moon phase and many more.One issue I was aware of before I purchased the watch is that there is no easy way to capture your “steps” on this watch. Fortunately You Tube is a great resource if you get stuck with something like this and I learned the third party app Pedometer ++ will resolve this issue to some extent and you can set it up as a “complication” as I did in the photo above. reviewTitle: A nice Watch, not much of an upgrade though
reviewDescription: UPGRADES from Series 7:S8 Chip:  This is basically the same as the S7 chip, with a few new integrated sensors:--Temperature Sensors:  Measures wrist temp. only while sleeping, takes five days to build baseline.  Currently only used to help retroactively analyze ovulation cycles after two cycles.  Not predictive.--High G accelerometer and improved gyroscope:  Able to detect car crashes and call for help.  (Same feature available in iPhone 14)-Different Color options: (Currently no blue or green?)That’s it.  Everything else is exactly the same as the Series 7.  The only way I can even tell them apart is by the color, otherwise they look the same.  The only benefits to upgrading to a Series 8 from a Series 7 would be the improved ovulation tracking features via nighttime wrist temperature, (though Apple warns that this is not necessarily predictive and should only be used to retroactively analyze your cycles after a couple months of use, and you would have to be wearing it at night often because this feature only uses sleep temp data), or the car-crash detection (but if you are going to get an iPhone 14, then this feature will be in your phone already).  So, if you are not interested in the ovulation data (or just don’t want to wear the watch every night- because maybe you charge it at night), and you plan to get an iPhone 14, then there is no reason to upgrade to this Series 8 at all.  The series 8 does come with Watch OS 9 which has some new software features, but all Apple Watches Series 4 or later can upgrade to this same OS 9.  (So that is Series 4, 5, 6, and 7, and SE, all support upgrading to Watch OS 9)So basically, it is hard to recommend getting this Watch Series 8.  If you can live without the wrist temp ovulation analysis and car crash detection in the watch, then I would suggest sticking with Series 7.  Even Series 6 isn’t that different in terms of performance, it and will still support Watch OS 9.  If you are buying your first Apple Watch, I would still suggest getting the less expensive Series 7.  Or you could also look into the new SE 2, which is about $150 less expensive than this Series 8, but lacks several other features like the Always-On-Display, ECG, blood oxygen and IP6X rating.

reviewTitle: Best Watch for Health and Daily Life!
reviewDescription: This is probably the most useful watch to own when it comes to health related tracking. It can track everything from your heart rate, exercise, standing time, distance, and sleep. As nice as that sounds I honestly barely use those functions. I imagine knowing this information probably help if I worried about my health personally, but what sold me on this watch is the other features. Here are a few I personally found incredibly useful.1. If you are a apple household and own several products and like me tend to lose them thru out the house, for example your iPhone. There is a nifty button on your touch screen that lets you buzz your phone and make it play a loud sound till you find it.2. Lets me track my wife and kids when they wander away and leave me all alone in target. I can either use my watch like a walkie-talkie and look like a weirdo spy in the store asking for help. Or I can see them on Find My iPhone (wife). (Requires setting up the family options)(Kinds creepy stalker option)3. I know when someone text messages me without looking at my phone. I can use siri to reply back by talking into my watch. Or ignore them like I usually do. . .4. I can pick out custom faces for my watch so I can use analog and impress absolutely no one. Or set it to digital military time and do math. Or best yet, pick one that shows me the weather which is really useful to understand why you are sweating in really bad places today and should probably find AC fast.5. The band that it comes with absolutely sucks but for about 1/3 of the price of the watch you can go to apple and choose from a crap ton of options. I honestly think they are worth the price so you don't get wrist sweat running down your hand. I do also recommend hunting down a screen protector on Amazon for your watch as well to protect the face from accidental dings.6. It has an app for that. Yep it has soooo many apps that do all the things that it can be very overwhelming. But some are really useful, like if I am listening to Spotify while jogging (walking speed but wheezing for effort) I can swipe songs I don't like and turn up and down the volume without grabbing my iphone from my pocket. Yes it isn't far but I am dying and probably drop my phone if I tried while running.7. Okay now for a more serious note. For the older generations it has a really useful feature on the newer models that allows you to monitor your heart and detects when you fall. If you fall it shows a sos button on your watch you can press to get help. If you don't move or respond after a minute or two it just makes the call for you. For the heart monitor you can set up your high/low BPM and have it track your heart and after awhile it can detect whether or not you have an irregular heart beat and warns you. It cannot track heart attacks but it can help you monitor your heart if you have any heart conditions so you can see a doctor. Please keep in mind that there is a lot of setup involved with these processes so if you are getting it as a gift for someone elderly or not very tech savvy. Please take the time to set it up and help them out. I found it somewhat easy just a bit time consuming.8. Lastly for the kids, it has a few features that I think are good to know for parents. The find my iPhone features shows you where they are even should they get separated from their iPhone as long as they have their watch on. If they should forget their iPhone and it gets too far from them the watch alerts them that they left it behind. It has a emergency call button (hold down the button under the crown *wheel thingy*) if they need 911 and sends out their current known location should the worst happen same as the iPhone. And lastly if someone plants the AirTag on them that isn't registered to them it alerts them that one is nearby.It does a lot more then what I listed but I think the review section would implode if I tried to list them all. These are just the ones I typically found useful. Like it also has a flash light feature and a spit water out the side after you wash your hands feature. If your curious to know more about the watch, apple does an amazing job on showing you all its features on their website so I would definitely visit it before you make the purchase. Also you can see all the wrist band options they sell so you can bling it out I guess. Hope this information helps you out!

I wanted to take advantage of the enhancements available on the Series 8 watch over the Series 5.  As I have COPD (a lung disorder) the ability to have quick access to the Blood/Oxygen level was a definite attraction.  The fall detection and crash detection were also a consideration.  Well, the watch is accurate as it gets its time from GPS signals.  I thankfully haven't had an occasion to test the fall or crash detection yet but the Blood/Oxygen reading is a complete joke for those of us who really need this statistic.  I have found that if the actual reading is low (anything below about 91%), I will inevitably get an "Unsuccessful Measurement" from the watch.  For people with advanced COPD, readings below this are quite common and need to be monitored.  Not only does it refuse to read low settings but the actual reading when it is available is way too high for medical tests.  The watch will inevitably read 2 to 5 percentage points above what the actual reading is on a calibrated SPO2 sensor.  When the watch shows a 92% oxygen saturation, you probably have an actual saturation level of 88 or 89% which is well below the safe margin.  Given the known results of that test, I actually have little faith in the watch's ability to detect a fall or crash.  Overall, I am disappointed in the watch as an enhancement over my Series 5 which I found to be very useful except for the short 18 hour battery life and the Series 8 didn't really improve on the requirement to charge the watch every night.

I bought this watch during Amazon Prime special. I have a Series 3 and was looking to get the extra benefits of having the newest series (without the Cellular). Watch was easy enough to set up and get going. I especially like the sleep information provided every morning. My big puppy ran into my arm one day and I got the message asking if I had fell down and should help be called. I sent no for those questions but was glad to see that if the issue presented itself, I would be able to take care of it. This watch feels like having an extra friend or family member keeping an eye out for me. Hopefully I will never have to use that or the car crash help. The “Dick Tracy” watch of the past has become a fantastic piece of the future right now.

This renewed Apple iwatch 8 came in almost perfect condition:  it had just a small nick in the very bottom corner that is hardly noticeable.  It functions perfectly, which is all that I ask.  A great deal.

My husband never wanted anything techy but with him going out into the woods and always having to pull his phone out he thought an apple watch would be a good idea but he was still on the fence about it. I bought this as a gift and he is in love with all the features, the being able to go fishing and hunting and having access to text and calls through his watch. He love the compass when he's out in the woods especially the fall feature as he climbs trees and always worries if something were to happen and no one is ever around how would he get his phone out to call. Huge plus!
Exactly as described.

El único punto flojo de este reloj es el mismo que todos. La batería dura muy poco por lo que a veces se me olvida cargarlo y entrenando me quedo sin batería a mitad entrenamiento. Pero fuera de eso está bastante bien. Es bastante fluido y tiene muchas funcionas que depende de uno en qué quiera ponerlo. Sobre todo lo uso para el deporte, recordatorios, mensajes emergentes y también para apuntar cosas en una lista rápida para que luego no se me olviden. Me gusta mucho y le doy mucho uso

As a disabled person, I’m extremely happy to be able to call, text, and use Siri from my wrist. I also like that  my vitals (except blood pressure) are continuously monitored. If I fall, the watch will ask if I need help to be called. I also love when using the map feature on my phone. My watch also tracks and “taps” my wrist when it’s time to turn. (Constant pattern to turn right. Syncopated pairs of taps for left). I could keep going but I think I’m running out of space.
Performance is great and easy set up.

reviewTitle: Seamless Upgrade: Trusting Apple's Timeless Quality with the Series 8
reviewDescription: Purchasing the Apple Watch Series 8 for my wife proved to be a seamless transition, especially since she was familiar with the previous model. The familiarity in design made it easy for her to use from the get-go, and the striking similarity to the older version didn't compromise its appeal. However, the Series 8 goes beyond aesthetics; it's a powerful performer. While it may look like its predecessor, it excels in functionality, showcasing Apple's commitment to innovation. As always, we trust Apple products for their reliability, and the Series 8 lives up to that trust by delivering a seamless and efficient user experience. It's not just a watch; it's a testament to Apple's dedication to quality and technological advancement.
Very pleased with this purchase - wear it daily
I love this watch!

This has been the best apple watch i've bought so far! I was between getting this and the ultra, but really didn't want to pay that much. The 8 seemed to offer all the key points I wanted (better sleep tracking, longer battery life, and water proof) and I cannot stress how great of a choice that was. Unless you are going to be diving I don't see the utility in the ultra. I wear this all day, everyday and during the summer I am always in the water. All I had to do was turn on the water lock and everything was good to go. Even with it submerged for a while, I have had no issue. Best apple watch for the price!

reviewTitle: I don't use my iPhone as frequently, AND the watch will locate my iPhone
reviewDescription: No regrets purchasing this Apple Watch. Thank goodness for YouTube "Apple Watch" tutorials, because I needed them to completely set up my watch for the custom features I really wanted. Love the watch features and multiple Watch "Faces" feature - so I can custom create a specific "Face" for my different activities: ie, "Work" watch face vs "Weekend" watch face vs "Exercise" watch face etc. I'm enjoying discovering and learning the capabilities it has to make my life run smoother, just like I am with my iPhone. I can even take a phone call on it (by accident the first time!! :), when I've miss placed my phone in that moment. Battery life is good and quickly recharges with the included watch charging cable. It readily magnetically links to the back of the watch, so you don't have to fuss with trying to insert a cable "end" connector to somewhere on the watch to charge it. Lastly, I like that I can readily change out the extra watch bands I purchased separately (with no tools required), to coincide with the physical activities planned or the varied settings I'm in.

My husband lost his Apple Watch back on vacation, I ordered this one for him. It works very well, does not lag, the picture quality is good. The connection between your watch and phone can go pretty far. Answering calls and text messages on the watch is really simple as well! If your on the fence just go for it ☺️
Just like all Apple products. The watch is perfect. I've dropped it a few times and it's never broken or scratched

This is my first Apple Watch so I have nothing to compare it to. It seems to be just fine although sometimes I want to say cuss words to it when it tells me it's time to stand up when I've only just had my first drink of coffee...lol

Moved up from a Fitbit Versa, watch is great ,easy to use / synch with phone, easy to set up, works great so far (have had it for a week) .  If you want to spend less $$ Fitbit has most of the same features the apple watch has and for less monies.  Only one complaint I have with the watch is that you have to charge it daily, with the fit bit charge would last at least 5 days.

I had a series 2 Apple Watch and its battery was not holding a charge anymore.  The model 2 watch is no longer software upgradeable and the cost to change the battery in it did not seem to be the smart move with all that has changed in the watch.  I love the new brighter display and the "constant on" feature of the display.  The battery is still at 50% at the end of the day when I place it on the charging puck, so the battery life is great in spite of the constant on display.  I still use pretty much the same apps as I did before so the upgrade was not for the apps but for the battery and display.  Now if Apple only included real time glucose monitoring for diabetics, that would be nirvana and the rating would likely be 5 stars.

reviewTitle: Excellent watch, battery life could be better.
reviewDescription: Love the watch, it does everything I need it to do and more. Sleep tracking is excellent, heart rate monitor and blood oxygen sensor are very useful. The alarm hasn’t failed me yet.The downside? Having all of those features constantly monitoring for changes drains the battery quicker than I’d like. Note that I dimmed the brightness of the display and turned off the “always on” feature. It helped a bit but to get the most out of the battery, you’ll have to turn off the active monitoring features.Low power mode is always an option if you’re really needing to conserve battery but it turns off 99 percent of features to do this.I have a charger nearby 95 percent of the time so that minimizes the issue somewhat.I‘d give it a half star back if that was an option (so realistically a 4.5 out of 5)Some people will say get the Ultra if you need a better battery, but I couldn’t justify $800.

I love this watch.  It’s an amazing piece of technology that works flawlessly.  Why only 4 stars?  Battery life.  Before owning this gen 8 I owned the gen 3.  The gen 3 could go 4 to 5 days on one charge.  This gen 8 I am lucky if I can get 2 days on a charge.  I hope Apple starts concentrating on improving battery performance.
Love its interface with my iPhone.  Great apps, extremely useful

reviewTitle: Good watch, but it's not the best
reviewDescription: I've liked this watch so far, as it's been pretty good in terms of noting down my sleep, tracking my fitness, along other things. One bad thing about this watch, though, is that it will collect the data for sleep and display it, but it won't relay information about the sleep itself. You need third-party apps you can get at the app store to tell you more or rate your sleep score.

Display is nice but the sleep tracking is not great at all. Bought this more expensive version to track basal body temp and can't figure out how to turn on the tracking and you have to wear it all night. Problem is, the battery life is terrible. I have to charge it midday or evening so then I lose out on the fitness tracking during that time.The larger display is really nice and overall I like it but there are some issues that should be resolved.

Yes I think it is a good watch. But I have to say that after 5 months the face surround started to delaminating.When I contacted Fitbit and sent the a picture they told sorry put that is not covered under the warranty. I willnot be buying any futher Fitbit products.

reviewTitle: Great watch, Still fair battery life
reviewDescription: The new HR monitoring features, and the ECG feature are nice. I like the exercise tracking and apps. The battery life is pretty limiting. I'd look at the youtub videos on various features and setup and how to try to minimize battery drain (eg background refresh, etc). An ok value, if you can get it on sale, like Prime Day or black friday.

This isn’t a cheap watch, and with all the things it can provide, it’s a perfect present. Unfortunately the magnetic charger doesn’t work even if you can find the correct power connection. So buyer beware you have to also invest in a charger for this watch. Not a happy Customer

I would warn again buying. The battery life is awful. It doesn't even last a day. The watch app on your smart phone doesn't really do anything besides set up the watch and change the watch face. I would return this if it were an option.

reviewTitle: . Very hard to use. The battery life is two days. I got four days out of a $59 watch.
reviewDescription: My cheap fitness watch was so much easier to use. The worst $500 I’ve ever spent.

I bought this iphone watches series 8, 45mn on Amazon, was the worse. It came in wrong collor wrist band , battery last only 7-9 hours with a 6 hours fully charged. Features are limited such as no blood pressure check and ...etc. This iphone watch might be a copy not the real one. I will bring it to apple store to check it, if it's real.  Overal was the worse and rating was a two. I will never purchase it again.
The box doesn’t look new, I got this to gift someone but seeing box it’s feels like a second hand watch box.

reviewTitle: not bad stuff but suck delivery
reviewDescription: I have waited for it for more than 5 days! It is so late since its estimated date was just 1 day.
I replaced this watch with my FitBit. It fits my small wrists well. Not great battery life. It needs to be charged every other day. My FitBit lasted up to 4 days. Pretty disappointed!!!

Facebook App is no longer available for Apple Watches. Sleep only tracks during you sleep window. So, if you fall asleep early or sleep in, it’s not tracked.  Naps also are not tracked. My old  Samsung S2 did a better job with sleep tracking. 🤷🏼‍♀️

reviewTitle: Does NOT come with power block
reviewDescription: This may be the most amazing device I will ever own. But I don’t know because mine came with no battery charge at all and requires a power block with a USB-C port to plug in. It seens like as expensive as this watch is, they could include a power block with it. I can plug it into a port on my computer but that isn’t convenient.

Love my new series 8 watch!! So many different features.  Only thing I dislike is the battery life, it’s not a good as my series 3 was! Doesn’t last as long but I guess that’s because the screen is always on.

reviewTitle: Love the watch but not nonstandard charger
reviewDescription: I just upgraded from the original Apple Watch 1 to the Apple Watch 8.  I love the always-on display and all the other features but they lose a star for not shipping it with a charger with a standard USB connector.  No charger cube, PC or laptop in my house has a USB-C connector so the charger is useless to me.  Fortunately, the charger that came with my old Apple Watch 1 works with the Apple Watch 8.
Lots of info. Good for health statistics. Battery needs to be charged every day, so that is inconvenient.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t come with charging block for charging cable
reviewDescription: Love the watch and even getting used to the cumbersome band that comes with it. Integrated easily with my IPhone 12 Pro Max. Doesn’t come with a charging block for the charging cable. The watch is useless without one. I knew that, but I had one with my iPhone and pad. How can Apple think that’s a fair way to do business. 4 stars for that BS!

reviewTitle: No USB-C wall adapter not mentioned in description
reviewDescription: Finally upgraded from Series 2 to Series 8.  Arrived on time but the watch battery was dead, and to my disappointment, there was no wall adapter for the USB-C cord provided. Shameful that a watch costs this much and Apple is too cheap to include everything to get going!  This definitely needs to be addressed in the lengthy watch description so one can order to have when watch arrives.

This is my second Apple Watch. Obviously I like them or I wouldn't go for round two. My big disappointment when ordering was about band size. I need a larger one, but there was confusion around the order and I ended up with a smaller one. While I could return the whole AW order, I didn't really want to do that. Now I'm using a new watch with an old band because I can't just swap bands and buying one identical to the one I have is a ridiculous price. So I'm stuck. I bought an aftermarket band, but it isn't what I truly want. To all of you ordering, be extra diligent when picking sizes. Yes, I should have returned it, but I didn't.

This watch keeps track of yards swam and can differentiate between the different strokes. It seems to subtract 25 yards from the total distance for about every 1000 yards I swim, so it’s not completely accurate. It is motivating me to complete yards in the pool however. It sends affirmations during the day when you complete goals, and that is also motivational.

reviewTitle: Activation Lock- Amazon and Apple Refuse to Take Off
reviewDescription: **** update****** Apple was eventually able to work with me to remove the activation lock but they are very particular about how to submit the proof of purchase and you need to document attempts of trying to handle this via Amazon first. Lengthy process that could be avoided if the activation lock was clear, bur happy with Apple in the end.I would buy new to avoid the time wasted. *****My refuirbished (used-like new) Watch came with an activation lock on it from the previous owner.I contacted Amazon for assistance, but they said that would need to go through Apple to get it removed and the refused to help beyond that (I was outside my return window since it was a gift months later).After submitting my case multiple times, Apple could verify the purchase I made, but can not do anything because of privacy reasons and that Amazon would have to help me (ping pong back and forth).There is no way for me to get into contact with the previous owner (obviously) and Amazon is not letting me return, exchange, or refund the item so now I just have a $300+ paperweight that would be perfectly functioning without the lock.Very disappointing financially and that the watch is now worthless.

reviewTitle: Great until it breaks 3 months after the warranty expires.
reviewDescription: Loved it until it stopped, conveniently right after the warranty ended. I loved the motivation it gave me to get out and walk around or workout. It was fun and informative tracking my health metrics on it too. Took it to the Apple store, called apple support, and brought it to Geek Squad, but no one was able to help. Very upset to learn that once an apple watch breaks, there's nothing apple can do for it - you have to buy a new one. Literally 3 months after the warranty expire, the wrist sensor stopped working, so I couldn't log any workouts, wouldn't get any notifications on my watch, couldn't do anything with it other than check the time and I didn't pay smart watch money to only be able to check the time.

I purchased this about a month ago.Pros: I have to use my phone computer less which is very good.Cons: it doesn’t work as advertised. The podcast app is trash, terrible interface. And that’s an Apple app, you can guess where it goes from there. Also, it didn’t work with my iPhone. I had to buy an ALL NEW IPHONE for this thing. So it was more like a near 3000$ purchase for a glorified pace counter (the pace counter app doesn’t work, I have to use the health app and see paces in there).I do like the health features, but for this price and for how bad the battery seems to be I can get better.I’ve been buying Apple for a decade. This is my last Apple product it was such a bad experience and let down in tech.Edit: ended up selling the watch after several months.It is awful at connecting to my AirPods instead of the phone, even when the phone is not near.The battery life is so bad. It barely gets through a day. If you use the sleep feature then you have to spend almost 2 hours the next day charging it at some point. That’s so awkward and just not at all what I’d expect for the money. It’s a bad product, most the high reviews seem to be from people who reviewed it the day they bought it.I cannot reiterate enough how poorly the battery life on this lasts. Unless you work at a desk and can sit and charge it off and on all day, it’s just not good.

reviewTitle: if it weren't for segments, it would be the perfect watch
reviewDescription: Bottom line:  if you sweat during a run, the watch starts recording segments at ridiculous intervals, like 25 yards.  You have to stop the run and start a new one.  Apple forums show I am not alone and it is not user error-it is wet sleeve or sweat.  It has reached the point that I am going to stop using this expensive item and buy a Garmin.  If it cannot perform the one thing I need it to, it is not worth it. I can live withtout the other feature and just rely on my phone.  Apple needs to fix this because otherwise, the watch is wonderful.  If you never work out, it might be great for you.

reviewTitle: Apple Watch Series 8 Not What I Expected
reviewDescription: I found purchasing the Apple Watch Series 8 confusing and not clear.  I was purchasing this for my Grand Nephew who just turned 10.  His parents and I agree that at 10 he is perhaps too young for a IPhone but the watch would enable him to call his friends who do have phones, text, and provide the ability to track his safety.  I spent large amounts of time in researching the capabilities of the Apple Watch Series 8 and purchased his watch from Amazon.  Sadly the first thing to go wrong - after a promise of a delivery date from Amazon Prime - the watch was 3 days late and not in time for his birthday.  We chose T-Mobile as our cellular provider and went in person to their store.  Just to find out that this particular watch was only WiFi enabled and NOT cellular enabled!  The watch cannot do what he wants to do --  talk and text.  The T-Mobile Customer Service Rep explained to me that this happens all the time and customers are very upset.  He said that the cellular enabled watch has a red button to indicate that it is cellular enabled.  I am now trying to return the watch to Amazon Prime and can 't seem to find a pathway to do so.

reviewTitle: PLEASE READ MY REVIEW BEFORE PURCHASING!
reviewDescription: I have never been more disappointed with an Amazon purchase in my life…upon purchasing I thought I read enough reviews on this watch that said “it was really great..” and so on, I bought the watch new and not refurbished and it was delivered within a day at my house.first impression was it was really beautiful cosmetic wise and that it seemed like a very solid watch until the set up process happened, I’ve tried everything under the sun to get this watch to stop “unpairing” from my iPhone and have watched countless videos and have done countless research to help me ensure I have all of my (settings right on my phone and I have newest updates, charging life on both electronics…etc) didn’t do a darn thing,I guess the only hope I have left is if someone who has had this similar issue has any other suggestions as to what I should try and attempt to do.I also want to preface..that it appears in the reviews the only people who had luck with this Apple Watch from this seller was if it was the black one and not the grey aluminum.So again I’m at a loss as to what to try and do and will most likely be returning this item, what a bummer.

reviewTitle: Clunky to wear and use, no valuable features for me
reviewDescription: I’ve had the Apple Watch for 7 months now and I can honestly say it is the biggest waste of money for me. It’s not comfortable to wear. It gives me no added functionality to my life. It got to where the only thing it was useful to me for was occasionally pinging my iPhone when I misplaced it/it got stuck in between couch cushions. I am honestly baffled at what people get out of it… right now mine is sitting in a drawer and serving zero purpose. You can see in answer texts with it. You can answer calls on it. But none of these were useful enough to justify wearing it. I can just use my phone for all these things. Maybe it’s just me, and someone can explain why people like it so much, but for me I would not recommend nor buy again.

Booooo! Poor form, Amazon, selling used/defective Apple Watches. I was excited to finally get an Apple Watch and I waited for Prime Days to get a better price. All seemed well and good when I opened the Apple Watch. Then I realized it was dead! No charge at all. I plugged it in for a couple hours but it wouldn’t charge. It also wouldn’t ‘pair’. I called Apple to try to work through these issues. I figured it HAD to be me. Their efforts proved fruitless. They asked for the serial number and asked me if I bought it from the previous owner. I told them I bought it from Amazon and they told me their records indicated it’d been sold three months prior… to someone else. Needless to say, I took Apple Customer Care’s  advise and returned it to Amazon for a refund. Two weeks later and I’m still ‘pissed’ at Amazon for selling used, defective stuff. Though this isn’t the first time I’ve received a used or broken (usually both) item from Amazon, this time it seemed more infuriating. Seriously considering canceling my Prime membership and no longer giving Amazon my business.

Received the item and charged before attempting to pair. Added the wrist strap and I was sent a 45mm band for the 41mm watch, wrong size. When it was fully charged, I tried to pair and the device wasn’t able to pair because it was linked to the prior owners account. Since the device had activation lock enabled, I’m not able to use the device at all. It would have been possible to submit a ticket to Apple to remove the activation lock, but Amazon didn’t send the serial number to serve as proof of purchase! It was packaged in a shipping bag with a cable and strap, no box, no paperwork. So now I have to send it back on day 1. Beware of the activation lock and also the return window. Since the item is Amazon renewed, the listing states a 90 money back guarantee but the return window is only 15 days! Buy with caution and patience. The only return option is through UPS pickup with a 30 day processing window. Would not recommend for a gift either.

I bought this watch 4/20/23 and it just died 6/21/24. Just over a year and they want to charge me 300+ dollars to fix it. Or the best suggestion was to purchase a new watch. Don’t waste your money. This is the second Apple Watch in a 3 year span to just randomly die. Save yourself the headache.

reviewTitle: Some functions highly innaccurate, most apps require subscription
reviewDescription: The sleep tracking is super inaccurate and almost all the apps for it require subscriptions, especially health and exercise ones! Many of the functions only work with paid subscription apps or work very poorly with apple health which then requires you to purchase a subscription for a better app. Highly overpriced for the value of what you actually get from apple. The battery life has also pretty much halved since I purchased 2 months ago, something I noticed after just a week or 2

Wearing an Apple watch is convenient in terms of receiving notifications and monitoring movements and sleep. It integrates easily with iPhone and is easy to setup and use.One feature I really wanted was measuring blood pressure, which watch 8 doesn't have but I heard it will be available early next year. This means I will have to upgrade within a year of purchasing this one.One complaint I have is that the watch is heavy (for a petite woman) and very uncomfortable, especially during intense workout.

reviewTitle: unable to charge out of box
reviewDescription: I am disappointed that I have to order additional equipment to charge my watch. It would be nice if you would advertise that it doesn't come with the adapter/wall plug/computer adapter to charge the watch. Yes, it comes with a power cord with the NEW type C end but not the additional item needed. If given the information with the purchase, I would have bought it. But, now I have to wait a few days in order for the additional order to be delivered. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE in my opinion.

I wanted a smart watch for a long time. Bought one and rarely wear it.  Not sure how to use it. Really wanted to use the sleep track but no idea how to use it.  I do wish it came with instructions.  Would I buy again no.  I would of sent it back but forgot to so  I’m stuck with an expensive smartwatch paperweight.

reviewTitle: Some apps don't work as expected
reviewDescription: I bought this for my husband birthday. Box arrived without the sealed clear plastic and shipping time was too long. When initiating the apple watch it had problems with the operating system but we were able to install it. After a few days in use the workout app is not working as expected it stops whenever it wants and does not record workouts as other apple watch we have.

While I love the watch it only lasted a little less than a year. It still works but it doesn’t hold a charge like it should. I used to get at least 2 full days before having to charge it. Now it doesn’t last a full day. Very disappointed. For the money they should last longer than that.

The software on the apple watch 8 I received needed to be updated in order to pair with my iphone 13 pro, but I couldn't pair it because the software isn't updated.  My techie husband and I spent hours going in circles trying to pair it, but it just went in circles back to the starting point.  We tried unpairing my old watch, updating iphone software, turning off/on, etc. Eventually, we figured out that my iphone software could be updated again to 16.0.3.  After updating the phone, the watch pairing and software updating worked.Apple support was not helpful.  I tried to make an appointment with the genius bar nearby but I was directed to a chat or call.  I called a support person and he didn't have any tips.  I also tried a chat with Apple support.  The first rep (or bot) ended the chat with a customer support survey link and then a second rep or bot asked how he could help.  If either rep would have instructed me to confirm my phone was at least version 16, it would have saved me hours of time.
I bought it specifically for the electrocardiogram function, but this function is not available in my country of residence, someone who has influence at Apple release the function for the whole world

reviewTitle: It’s not much of an upgrade over the Series-7
reviewDescription: I gave away my Series-7 to a family member and got the Series-8.  It really is a very minor update over the Series-7.  While the Series-8 includes a new “temperature” sensor, the Series-7 comes with lots of color options that matches your style and taste.  In all honesty, the “temperature” feature is not even what you expect it to be, I thought it could track my actual temperature and it would tell me if I’m getting a fever or something.  It doesn’t do that, it was meant to track “ovulation.”  As a male, it is pointless, I would rather have the color options.  Additionally, in terms of accuracy, sleep tracking, and battery life, it is just ok.  It is no better than the Series-7 in terms of battery life, the accuracy of readings and sleep tracking is ok at best.  I love apple products but it really isn’t as accurate as I would like it to be.  Just keep your expectations reasonably low and you won’t be disappointed.

reviewTitle: You can get the same apps and workout health info on your iPhone.
reviewDescription: This was hard to set up even though your phone 13 pro max . It must be updated we had auto update but doesn’t work if your phone is set on alarm . Free app for three months with purchase but if you are really into getting healthier you need more which you could buy for your iPhone . Water resistant is not waterproof so swimming in it seemed scary and expensive if it wasn’t. It doesn’t do anything your phone won’t . I found I really don’t need this expensive thing to worry about I have apple care on my phone
Switched from a FitBit which I could navigate through the options pretty easy. Apple watch has to many options that I find not necessary for me but can't remove.
I purchased the Apple Watch mostly for being able to run a EEG . I have been disappointed to say the least , the results are not accurate !

The watch honestly can be replaced by a fit bit . I don’t if I got a bad one but it’s not calibrated correctly . It says I’m standing when I’m not . Claims I am moving when I am not . I think it’s over priced . It’s Apple after all

I loved the watch.  Problem the adaptor, I believe is defective.  Does not fit any of my banks.  I was told to return it.  However, I bought it during Prime days.  Although I can return I cannot replace, which means. I would have to repurchase which would be a hundred dollars more.  So really it’s just cheaper to purchase another adapter.

I like most things about this phone, but the heart rate isn’t correct, when I read at night the phone thinks I’m sleeping and the battery life is SUPER short! Every day the battery needs to be charged. My little Fitbit would last 3 days before needing a battery charge.

Nothing special. I had a version 1 42mm that died so I got the latest version in the 45mm. I then realized that it’s nothing more than a legit, glorified watch that sends me notifications of spam emails and some texts. Regerts…. No need to spend the money on this thing for what I use it for. Should have gone with like a 5 or something.The screen is large and I can see videos and pictures as long as my phone is near which is fine but there’s not a lot I use it for. Plus I had to get an otter box case for the screen. It’s not meant for carelessness. Bang it into something and that screen is dead!
I got it but they gave me the wrong size, I ordered a 45mm and ended up getting sent a 41mm but decided to try it out anyways and was good just hopefully when I return it they give me the right size.

First apple watch for me and i can say that i love the features of this watch. Only downside is that i am allergic to some metals and something in this watch is triggering the reaction (see above). I have ordered new bands to see if they will help.

I like the Apple Watch 8 Series except for the battery life. I literally have to charge it every night in order for the battery to last all day. This shouldn't happen, the battery should last a lot longer. Other than the battery life, I love my Apple Watch.

reviewTitle: No user control of apps etc.
reviewDescription: I bought this watch to replace a 3 year old series 5 that went into a “reboot lock “, as was diagnosed by the Apple websiteThe new watch took ages to pair to my iPhone, when done it was totally confusing to use. It would constantly ask for my password, even when I wearing it.Trying to eliminate unwanted apps provided to be impossible, even with assistance from the Apple team.I returned the watch to Amazon where I had bought it.It was dropped off at UPS store Dec 2 , 7 days ago, so far no sign of my refundIt took until Jan 7 th 2023 for the refund to be credited to my account

If I don't use any of the Apps on the watch the battery lasts a long time. But I use some of the Apps and have to charge the watch in 36 hours. Very disappointing.I like the ECG, Compass and Workout Apps. I like variety of faces for watch. But I would like to choose options to display with the faces.

I purchased the new Apple Watch 8 for my wife as an anniversary gift. She loves anything and everything apple, and I myself prefer other options.As for a review, I am comparing the Apple Watch 8 to my Garmin Venu 2.Many of the added and new features of Apple's newest watch, like SOS and biometrics monitoring, have been a staple in their competitors' products for a while now.Comparing the responsiveness of the Series 8 to the Venu 2 is quite a big leap, as the Series 8 has a faster chip and can perform many tasks, including video animations like Toy Story characters running around the screen with phenomenal clarity and resolution, which is one thing it does that my Garmin does not.Comparing the reliability, however, does show how Apple is lacking in the functionality of its watch. To start, the GPS signal in the Garmin is better than the Series 8 when out in the wilderness or anywhere where the signal may not be as great, whereas the Series 8 seems to lack a proper signal. As well as my Garmin has more accurate biometrics reading when comparing our vitals being monitored with a pulse oximetry device.Overall the build quality seems comparable to my Garmin, as both have been plunged into deep enough water, both in the ocean and in 10'  swimming pools. Neither has shown any water damage since. For impact damage, the Apple watch seems to be more resilient as my Venu 2 has a few dings here and there for it hitting desks, and normal wear and tear, yet the Apple Watch still looks as good as it did out of the box.Overall, the Apple Watch 8 is a great product for someone who likes to stay in the Apple ecosystem.

reviewTitle: Alice in Wonderland Meets The Apple Watch Band
reviewDescription: It is a well-known fact that I'm not Alice, and this ain't Wonderland, but my new wrist band begs to differ. I am certain that even my pet hamster, Sir Fluffington, would struggle with this fashion statement.I jumped in too fast and sync'd my phone before even trying it on - a rookie mistake fueled by caffeine, enthusiasm, and an overly zealous sense of faith in Apple and Amazon. Turns out, my watch now holds every iota of my personal information while snugly attached to a band that wouldn't fit a toddler.Now comes the real predicament: do I return it, risking my personal data, my sanity, and the peaceful coexistence of my coffee machine and me? Or do I keep it and use this wrist band as a constant reminder of my hasty decisions, and an unintentional toy for Sir Fluffington?One would think this mishap would warrant a single-star review. Still, I'm giving it three because the band may be doll-sized, but it sure is pretty. Plus, the hilarity of this episode has given me more laughs than any comedy special on Netflix recently.The silver lining? Next time I'll check the size chart more carefully and if I ever get invited to a tea party in Wonderland, I've got just the accessory to impress the Mad Hatter!Laughing at my own misfortune,Your Fellow Tiny Band Sufferer.
